parameters:
\N<Luda Soldier>This is the archive where we store the march records of
Luda. It contains records of engagements, war results, and
even prisoners.

\N<Luda Soldier>A permit is required to view the archives. Most of these are
issued only upon successful extermination of the masters of
each stratum's ruins.

\N<Luda Soldier>Upon the extermination of a ruin's master, bring here the
proof of your deed. Then, as a reward, I shall grant you
permission to view our army's march records.

\N<Luda Soldier>This is the archive where we store the records of Luda's
military campaigns. It contains records of engagements,
battle results, and even documents regarding prisoners of
war.

\N<Luda Soldier>Hey, what have you been doing since a while ago? Do you have
business here?

\N<Segi>(Wait... Didn't Zuuteruka or the weapon shop owner say
something...?)
\N<Segi>(Something about his past... an incident or something...)

\N<Segi>(...That's right. Fubii... That person once said they
single-handedly defeated bandits a long time ago.)

\N<Segi>(If that's the case, it must have been a quite noteworthy
incident... There might be books related to that event here
as well.)
\N<Luda Soldier>Hey, are you listening? What are you doing?

\N<Segi>Oh, um... As a citizen of the town... and as a participant
in the training corps, I wanted to familiarize myself with
your records and history.
\N<Segi>...I came today to look into that. May I have permission...?
\N<Luda Soldier>Hmm, well alright. Do as you like.

\N<Segi>(Even if I find books related to the incident, whether there
will be any results is fifty-fifty... But I'll look into it.
It's surely better than doing nothing.)

\N<Segi>(Fubii... They said it was to participate in the training
corps, but where did they originally come from...?)

\N<Luda Soldier>This is the archive where we store the records of Luda's
military campaigns. It contains records of engagements,
battle results, and even documents regarding prisoners of
war.

\N<Luda Soldier>This is the archive where we store the records of Luda's
military campaigns. It contains records of engagements,
battle results, and even documents regarding prisoners of
war.

\N<Luda Soldier>This is the archive where we store the march records of
Luda. It contains records of engagements, battle results,
and even documents regarding prisoners of war.

"Luda Expedition Record 1" Independent Night Watch Nation
"Dawn's Ear". At the home of former vigilante leader Orugi
and his wife Seno.

"Luda Expedition Record 1" - At the home of Orugi, the
former vigilante leader, and his wife Seno, in the
independent night-watch nation "Dawn's Ear."

\N<Segi>(... "Record of Bandit Attacks by Former Orphanage
Residents" ...)

\N<Segi>...This is the only library in town, but... I wonder if I
can find any information about that person here.

\N<Segi>Besides, ever since Luda's soldiers came, most of the books
have been replaced with their propaganda materials for
enlightenment.
\N<Segi>In such a place... personal records of him...

"Chronicles of the Luda Expedition 2" - Records of the
March to the Independent Night Watch Nation "Dawn's Ear". In
the private chambers of the Grand Duke and Princess Consort
Suia.

"Chronicles of the Luda Expedition 2" - Records of the
March to the Independent Night Watch Nation "Dawn's Ear". In
the private chambers of the Grand Duke and Princess Consort
Suia.

"Marching Records of Luda 3" - Independent Night Watch
State "Dawn's Ear" military records. Regarding Princess
Consort Suia, militia member Seno, and the handling of the
remnants of defeated soldiers.

"Luda Expedition Record 3" Independent Night Watch State
"Dawn's Ear" Expedition Record. Regarding Princess Consort
Suia and the self-defense force member Seno, as well as the
treatment of the remaining defeated soldiers.

"Luda Expedition Record 4" Independent Night Watch State
"Dawn's Ear" Expedition Record. Regarding the treatment of
Mistress Suia and Seno thereafter.

"Record of Luda's March 4" - The Independent Night Watch
State "Dawn's Ear". Regarding the treatment of courtesan
Suia and Seno thereafter.

"Luda Expedition Record 5" - Independent Night Watch State
"Dawn's Ear" Expedition Record. Regarding the reassignment
of Mistress Suia and Seno.

"Luda Campaign Record 5" Independent Night Watch Nation
"Dawn's Ear" Campaign Salary. Regarding the reassignment of
courtesan Suia and Seno.

"Luda Expedition Record 6" Independent Night Watch State
"Dawn's Ear" Expedition Record. Regarding the comfort of
Mistress Suia and the new recruit Seno.

"Luda Expedition Record 6" Independent Night Watch Nation
"Dawn's Ear" Expedition Record. Regarding the comfort of
Mistress Suia and the new recruit Seno.
